alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 5:21PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: .A large run of high water and ice is now moving past Fort Yukon. Water levels are bankfull and fluctuating. If the ice stops moving and jams downstream water levels will rise very rapidly. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...Yukon River near Fort Yukon. * WHEN...Until 515 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low lying areas near Fort Yukon is imminent or occurring. Flooding as well as large blocks of ice being pushed onshore is expected. When the ice jams just downstream, water will rise very rapidly, and water will remain high until the ice jam releases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 510 PM AKDT, The River Watch Team reports ice in place downstream on Fort Yukon, and a heavy run of ice and high water now passing through Fort Yukon. When the run of ice and high water reaches the in place ice downstream of Fort Yukon, it is expected to form an ice jam and back water and ice up into Ft Yukon and cause rapid river rises upstream at Fort Yukon. - People in Fort Yukon should prepare now to move to high ground at a moments notice. Flooding could occur anytime between now and Monday. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Yukon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River at Fort Yukon stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
